meanings.definition: Curved or hooked like an eagle's beak.
meanings.sent1: The hawk had an aquiline beak that helped it catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The eagle's aquiline beak was perfect for tearing into its meal.
meanings.sent3: The aquiline beak of the bird made it look like it was always smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her aquiline profile cut through the crowd like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The aquiline curve of the bridge mirrored the shape of a soaring eagle.

meanings.sent1: The aquiline feathers of the bird shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The majestic eagle's aquiline wingspan was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The aquiline symbol on the flag represented strength and freedom.
meanings.sent4: Her aquiline gaze seemed to pierce through any facade.
meanings.sent5: The aquiline silhouette of the eagle against the sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Sharp or prominent like an eagle's nose.
meanings.sent1: His aquiline nose gave him a regal appearance.
meanings.sent2: The actress had an aquiline profile that photographers loved.
meanings.sent3: The aquiline nose on the statue made it look like it was sniffing the air.
meanings.sent4: Her aquiline features stood out in a sea of ordinary faces.
meanings.sent5: The aquiline angle of his jawline added to his striking good looks.
